channel.title: Informatica Intelligent Cloud Services Status - Incident History

item.title: Global Phone Verification Cloud March Reference Data Updates
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Informatica Cloud Operations Update Reference Data for Global Phone Verification Cloud Services

No impact on running jobs or services due to scheduled update of reference data by Informatica Cloud Operations.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 19, 07:00 - 09:00 PDT

Mar 12, 09:01 PDT
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will update reference data used by Global Phone Verification Cloud services. This is a Zero Downtime activity with no impact on running jobs or services.

item.title: Upcoming Maintenance on February Upgraded PODs for importing LDO profile failing with internal DTM error
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Patch Deployment for IICS US West 5 and IICS EM West 1 Services

Informatica Cloud Operations will be applying a patch on IICS US West 5 Services, IICS EM West 1 Services to resolve an issue without impacting running jobs or services. No action is required.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 13, 04:30 - 06:30 PDT

Mar 12, 07:13 PDT
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be applying a patch on IICS US West 5 Services, IICS EM West 1 Services, which is a February Upgraded POD for Cloud Data Profiling services. This is to resolve the failure of source mapplet Profile asset import. This is a Zero Downtime deployment and will not impact running jobs or services.

Action Required: None

item.title: Address Verification Cloud Engine Update
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Engine Update for Address Verification Cloud Services

Informatica Cloud Operations will update the engine used by Address Verification Cloud services to 5.16.4. This is a Zero Downtime activity with no impact on running jobs or services.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 19, 05:00 - 07:00 PDT

Mar 12, 06:36 PDT
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will update the engine used by Address Verification Cloud services to 5.16.4. This is a Zero Downtime activity with no impact on running jobs or services.

Note that all pertinent information regarding our monthly data updates will be made available on https://docs.informatica.com/data-as-a-service/address-verification-(on-premises)/5-16-3.html and https://docs.informatica.com/data-as-a-service/address-verification-(on-premises)/6-4-0/address-verification-database-release-guide/preface.html.

item.title: User may have noticed intermittent Cloud Data Integration job failures on the USW3 POD.
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Intermittent Job Failures on USW3 POD Summary: Users might have noticed intermittent job failures on the USW3 POD. The issue occurred from 2:00 AM GMT to 7:00 AM GMT and proactive measures have been taken to mitigate the issue for now. We are actively monitoring for any further instances.

Mar 11, 13:30 PDT
Resolved - Users might have noticed intermittent job failures on the USW3 POD Start time: 2:00 AM GMT End time 7:00 AMT GMT. Proactive measures have been taken to mitigate the issue for now. We are actively monitoring for any further instances

item.title: Planned Maintenance for Operational Insights
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Informatica Cloud Operations Update

During the scheduled maintenance window, there may be delays in processing alerts as Informatica Cloud Operations will be updating a microservice which affects Operational Insight.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 26, 20:00 - 22:00 PDT

Mar 11, 18:56 PDT
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be updating a microservice which affects Operational Insight. While this will be a Zero Downtime deployment, there may be delays in processing alerts during the maintenance window.

item.title: April 2024 Major release for IICS Sandbox (PRE-RELEASE)
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Release of Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) April 2024

The Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) April 2024 major release offers incredible new capabilities across all products, addressing key data challenges that businesses are facing today. The release is scheduled from 7:00am to 12:00pm PDT on March 18, 2024. More details can be found in the What‚Äôs New Guide, FAQ, and Release Readiness Documentation provided. Please refer to the resources for detailed information.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 18, 07:00 - 12:00 PDT

Mar 11, 14:23 PDT
Scheduled - We are excited to announce the Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) April 2024 major release.

Release Date Time:

March 18th, 2024 from 7:00am to 12:00pm Pacific Daylight Time.

The Intelligent Data Management Cloud (IDMC) April 2024 major release offers incredible new capabilities across all our various products that address key data challenges that businesses are facing today.

For more details about the April 2024 major release, please refer to the following resources:

üÜï What‚Äôs New Guide:

Discover the latest capabilities in our What‚Äôs New Guide: https://onlinehelp.informatica.com/IICS/prod/WhatsNew/en/index.htm

‚ùì FAQ:

Find answers to common questions and learn about any behavior changes in our FAQ: https://knowledge.informatica.com/s/article/IDMC-Release-FAQ?language=en_US

üìö Release Readiness Documentation:

Gain a comprehensive understanding of release types and expectations, including Runtime Continuity for major releases, by visiting our Release Readiness documentation: https://docs.informatica.com/cloud-common-services/administrator/h2l/1772-release-readiness/landing-page.html

üåë Setting a Blackout Period:

Learn how to set a blackout period effectively by following this guide: https://docs.informatica.com/cloud-common-services/administrator/current-version/organization-administration/schedules/configuring-a-blackout-period.html

üóìÔ∏è Stay Informed:

Keep track of all upcoming release and maintenance schedules for IDMC by visiting our Events page: https://network.informatica.com/s/event-landing

item.title: Minor Maintenance on EM West 1 Services for API Manager.
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Solr Re-indexing and Wso2 Service Restart Scheduled

Summary: Solr re-indexing and Wso2 service restart will be performed on March 11th, causing a temporary disruption in the creation/edition of new APIs and rate limit functionality. The activity is expected to be completed within 30 minutes.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 11, 02:30 - 03:00 PDT

Mar 11, 00:54 PDT
Scheduled - Solr re-indexing will be performed at 2:30 AM PST on 11th March in APIM AWS EMEA Manager node. This requires restarting of wso2 services on manager node. Activity will be completed in 30min.
Impact during the activity:-
-creation/edition of new api's won't work for sometime
-rate limit won't work for sometime

item.title: Planned Maintenance with Downtime impacting CDGC on US (AWS) and CDGC Canada CACENTRAL1
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Service Maintenance

Informatica Cloud Operations will be performing maintenance on the Data Governance and Catalog services as well as Data Marketplace, leading to a 2-hour downtime impacting user interface accessibility and scheduled activities execution.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 24, 01:00 - 03:00 PDT

Mar 8, 11:17 PST
Scheduled - Services: Data Governance and Catalog, Data Marketplace

DOWNTIME: 2 hours


Date/Time: Sunday, March 24th, 2024 (1:00am to 3:00am Pacific Daylight Time)

Informatica Cloud Operations will be performing maintenance on the Data Governance and Catalog services as well as Data Marketplace. During the maintenance activity, the database utilized by these services will undergo a minor version upgrade which is expected to take 2 hours to complete.

Impact: The user interface will not be accessible and any scheduled activities will fail to execute.

There will not be any changes to the functionality of the application.

For further questions, contact Global Customer Support at: https://www.informatica.com/services-and-training/customer-success-services/contact-us.html.

item.title: Planned Maintenance with Downtime impacting CDGC on UK and EM West 1 PODs
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Maintenance and Database Upgrade Summary: Informatica Cloud Operations will be performing maintenance on the Data Governance and Catalog services, as well as Data Marketplace. This will result in 25 minutes of downtime, impacting the user interface and scheduled activities.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 23, 20:00 - 21:00 PDT

Mar 8, 11:21 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be performing maintenance on the Data Governance and Catalog services as well as Data Marketplace. During the maintenance activity, the database utilized by these services will undergo a minor version upgrade over a 1 hour maintenance period which will result in 25 minutes of Downtime.

Impact: The user interface will not be accessible and any scheduled activities will fail to execute.

There will not be any changes to the functionality of the application.

For further questions, contact Global Customer Support at: https://www.informatica.com/services-and-training/customer-success-services/contact-us.html.

item.title: Planned Maintenance with Downtime impacting CDGC on AP SouthEast 1 and AP NorthEast 2 PODs
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Maintenance and Downtime

Informatica Cloud Operations will be performing maintenance on the Data Governance and Catalog services as well as Data Marketplace. The database utilized by these services will undergo a minor version upgrade over a 1 hour maintenance period, resulting in 25 minutes of downtime. The user interface will not be accessible and any scheduled activities will fail to execute.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 23, 09:00 - 10:00 PDT

Mar 8, 11:19 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be performing maintenance on the Data Governance and Catalog services as well as Data Marketplace. During the maintenance activity, the database utilized by these services will undergo a minor version upgrade over a 1 hour maintenance period which will result in 25 minutes of Downtime.

Impact: The user interface will not be accessible and any scheduled activities will fail to execute.

There will not be any changes to the functionality of the application.

For further questions, contact Global Customer Support at: https://www.informatica.com/services-and-training/customer-success-services/contact-us.html.

item.title: Upcoming maintenance on February upgraded PODs for Operational Insights
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Informatica Cloud Operations Patch Update

Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress to apply a patch affecting Operational Insights to resolve a connection issue. There will be a restart of the application, with potential downtime of up to 10 minutes. Summary: Patch update in progress to resolve a connection issue affecting Operational Insights.

Mar 8, 10:30 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Mar 8, 10:20 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be applying a patch affecting Operational Insights to resolve an issue connecting to a domain.

Error while testing connection to the domain from the Ops Insight.

NoClassDefFoundError: Could not initialize class com.informatica.opsinsights.datacollector.utils.multiversion.MultipleDomainVersionWrapper

Downtime: There will be a restart of the Operational Insights application which can take up to 10 minutes.

item.title: Upcoming maintenance on February upgraded PODs for MDM SaaS Merge and Unmerge Issues
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Scheduled Patch Deployment Summary: Informatica Cloud Operations will be applying patches to address merge failures and unmerge API issues. No impact to MDM SaaS services is expected.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 8, 00:30 - 02:30 PST

Mar 7, 04:42 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be applying patches which will take care of issue around merge failures for a cluster having high number of records ( 800+ related records), and solves issue where merge fails with "All records contained by the masters are not ready for match" error. This EBF also handles Unmerge API failing when undocumented parameters were used.

Note that it is a zero downtime deployment and no impact to MDM SaaS services is expected.

Action Needed: None.

item.title: Upcoming Maintenance for Cloud Data Governance and Catalog, Cloud Data Marketplace, and Metadata Command Center ‚Äì AP East 2 Azure Services, EM SouthEast 1 Azure Services, Canada Central 1 Azure Services
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Cloud Data Governance and Catalog, Cloud Data Marketplace, and Metadata Command Center Update Summary: Informatica Cloud Operations is upgrading the software with new features and bug fixes, locking write and change operations during the process. Users will be notified through in-application banners. The user interface will still be continually available during the upgrade window.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 13, 02:30 - 05:30 PDT

Mar 6, 19:31 PST
Scheduled - Cloud Data Governance and Catalog, Cloud Data Marketplace, and Metadata Command Center are being updated with new features and bug fixes. For any Org not already manually upgraded by users, Informatica Cloud Operations will upgrade remaining Orgs to the latest software version.

üÜï What‚Äôs New Guide:

Discover the latest capabilities in our What‚Äôs New Guide: https://onlinehelp.informatica.com/IICS/prod/WhatsNew/en/index.htm#page/aa-iics-whats-new/Data_Governance_and_Catalog.html

üìö Release Readiness Documentation:

 Gain a comprehensive understanding of release types and expectations by visiting our Release Readiness documentation: https://docs.informatica.com/cloud-common-services/administrator/h2l/1772-release-readiness/landing-page.html

‚ùì FAQ:

 Find answers to common questions and learn about any behavior changes in our FAQ: https://knowledge.informatica.com/s/article/IDMC-Release-FAQ?language=en_US

üóìÔ∏è Stay Informed:

 Keep track of all upcoming release and maintenance schedules for IDMC by visiting our Events page: https://network.informatica.com/s/event-landing

‚ùó Attention:

 During the upgrade window for Cloud Data Governance and Catalog and Cloud Data Marketplace, the user interface will be continually available. However, the upgrade processes will lock write and change operations and users will be notified through in-application banners.

item.title: Minor Maintenance on West 3 POD for API Manager.
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - API Manager Maintenance Summary: API Manager service will be undergoing maintenance on US West 3 POD. API Gateway and API invocations are not impacted during this maintenance. API Manager User Interface may be unavailable during the maintenance impacting creation of new managed APIs and rate limit policy. All other services will continue to operate normally.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 6, 02:30 - 03:00 PST

Mar 6, 01:53 PST
Scheduled - API Manager service will be undergoing maintenance on US West 3 POD.
API Gateway and API invocations are not impacted during this maintenance.
API Manager User Interface may be unavailable during the maintenance impacting creation of new managed APIs and rate limit policy.

All other services will continue to operate normally.

item.title: Cloud Application Integration maintenance on EM West 1 Services
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Cloud Application Integration Patch Deployment

Informatica Cloud Operations will be deploying patches on the February standard release of Cloud Application Integration on the EM West 1 POD. This is a Zero Downtime update, and all services will remain operational. Action Needed: none. Summary: Scheduled deployment of patches for Cloud Application Integration with no expected downtime.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 5, 20:00 - 22:00 PST

Mar 5, 08:06 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be deploying patches on the February standard release of Cloud Application Integration on the EM West 1 POD.

This is a Zero Downtime update, and all services will remain operational.

Action Needed: none.

item.title: Products Icons are not getting Loaded Properly for All Pods
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Product Icon Loading Issue Summary: The service Page is experiencing an issue with product icons not loading, but it is not impacting the functionality of the Pod or product jobs. The team is working on a fix and will provide an update soon.

Mar 4, 21:00 PST
Investigating - We are facing an issue on the service Page where the Icons of Products are not getting loaded up. Functionality there is no impact on Pod and product all the jobs will continue to run without any issues. We have been working to fix this issue and will post the progress shortly.

item.title: Address Verification Cloud March Reference Data Updates
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Address Verification Cloud Services Update Summary: Informatica Cloud Operations will be updating reference data used by Address Verification Cloud services. This is a Zero Downtime activity with no impact to running jobs or services.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 19, 05:00 - 07:00 PDT

Mar 4, 09:13 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be updating reference data used by Address Verification Cloud services. This is a Zero Downtime activity with no impact to running jobs or services.

Action Needed: none.

item.title: Upcoming Maintenance on February Upgraded pods for CDGC
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Patch deployment for Informatica Cloud Operations

Informatica Cloud Operations will be rolling out a patch to address the scorecard job failure issue for a few scenarios. This deployment will have zero downtime to ensure that running jobs and services remain unaffected.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 4, 04:30 - 06:30 PST

Mar 4, 02:04 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will roll out a patch to resolve the scorecard job failure issue for few scenarios. This deployment will have Zero Downtime, ensuring that running jobs and services remain unaffected.
has context menu

item.title: Upcoming Maintenance patch for CDGC on US West 1 Azure Services, US West 3 Azure Services, Canada Central 1 Services, Canada Central 1 Azure Services
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Scheduled Maintenance for Informatica Cloud Operations Summary: Informatica Cloud Operations is undergoing scheduled maintenance to resolve issues related to CDGC page responsiveness, user and group optimizations, Azure/MDX Serverless Scans, and bulk promotion functionality. No downtime is expected during this deployment.

Mar 1, 05:45 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Mar 1, 05:31 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will roll out a patch to resolve the following CDGC issues. This deployment will have Zero Downtime, ensuring that running jobs and services remain unaffected:

1) The CDGC page becomes unresponsive when clicking on the search bar.
2) Optimizations are required for fetching users and groups within CDGC apps, especially for organizations with a large number of users and groups.
3) Azure/MDX Serverless Scans are currently failing due to a logback exception.
4) After performing a bulk promotion using Bulk-import, the expected relationship is not formed.

item.title: Upcoming Maintenance patch for CDGC on AP SouthEast 2 Azure Services AP NorthEast 1 Azure Services & EM SouthEast 1 Azure Services
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Scheduled Maintenance for Informatica Cloud Operations Summary: Informatica Cloud Operations will roll out a patch to resolve various issues with CDGC, ensuring that running jobs and services remain unaffected. No action is needed, and the deployment will have zero downtime.

Mar 1, 04:26 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 29, 23:30 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 29, 23:16 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will roll out a patch to resolve the following CDGC issues. This deployment will have Zero Downtime, ensuring that running jobs and services remain unaffected:

1) The CDGC page becomes unresponsive when clicking on the search bar.
2) Optimizations are required for fetching users and groups within CDGC apps, especially for organizations with a large number of users and groups.
3) Azure/MDX Serverless Scans are currently failing due to a logback exception.
4) After performing a bulk promotion using Bulk-import, the expected relationship is not formed.



Action Needed: None

item.title: Upcoming Maintenance patch for CDGC on CDGC Azure Germany, CDGC UK, CDGC EMEA
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Informatica Cloud Operations Patch Deployment Summary: Informatica Cloud Operations is deploying a patch to resolve several issues within CDGC, including unresponsiveness of the CDGC page, optimization for fetching users and groups, failure of Azure/MDX Serverless Scans, and issues with bulk promotions. No downtime is expected during this deployment. [Low] - Informatica Cloud Operations Regular Maintenance Summary: Informatica Cloud Operations is currently undergoing scheduled maintenance. Updates will be provided as necessary.

Mar 1, 04:00 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Mar 1, 03:36 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will roll out a patch to resolve the following CDGC issues. This deployment will have Zero Downtime, ensuring that running jobs and services remain unaffected:

1) The CDGC page becomes unresponsive when clicking on the search bar.
2) Optimizations are required for fetching users and groups within CDGC apps, especially for organizations with a large number of users and groups.
3) Azure/MDX Serverless Scans are currently failing due to a logback exception.
4) After performing a bulk promotion using Bulk-import, the expected relationship is not formed.

item.title: Upcoming maintenance patch for Advance Integration.
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Scheduled Maintenance - Applying maintenance patch for WES services resiliency during profiling jobs.

Summary: Maintenance patch is being applied to address WES services resiliency while running profiling jobs. No impact to Task executions is expected.

Mar 1, 01:30 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Mar 1, 01:29 PST
Scheduled - We are applying maintenance patch. This is a zero down time update and there should be no impact to Task executions. This fix is to address WES services resiliency while running profiling jobs.

item.title: Opsinsight external SSL certificate for AP NorthEast 2 Services, US West 1 GCP Services
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Opsinsight External SSL Certificate Renewal

The Opsinsight external SSL certificate is getting expired and external cert rotation is taking place. There will be no downtime for this activity, but there can be a small network glitch at the time of renewal which is very minimal. Summary: Opsinsight is renewing its external SSL certificate, with no expected downtime, but a small network glitch may occur during the renewal process.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 29, 20:30 - 21:30 PST

Feb 29, 03:48 PST
Scheduled - The Opsinsight external SSL certificate is getting expired and external cert rotation is taking place.

There will be no downtime for this activity. But there can be a small network glitch at the time of renewal which is very minimal.

item.title: Upcoming Maintenance on February Upgraded PODs for B2B mapping failures.
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Scheduled Maintenance Update Summary: Informatica Cloud Operations is deploying a patch to address an issue with Cloud B2B mappings failing with "Record was too long" errors. This deployment will have no impact on running jobs or services.

Feb 28, 22:01 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 28, 21:45 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be deploying a patch to address an issue with Cloud B2B mappings failing with "Record was too long" errors. This is a Zero Downtime deployment and there will be no impact to running jobs or services.

Action Needed: None.

item.title: AWS RDS maintenance activity affecting CDGC, MCC & CDMP services on IICS AP SouthEast 1 Services and IICS AP NorthEast 2 Services
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Emergency RDS Maintenance in CDGC AP SouthEast 1 and IICS AP NorthEast 2 Services

During a planned emergency RDS maintenance activity, there will be about 20 minutes of downtime during the DB Upgrade/Restart, resulting in brief interruptions for CDGC, CDMP, and MCC services. Please refrain from scheduling any critical jobs during this time window.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 2, 05:00 - 05:20 PST

Feb 28, 10:03 PST
Scheduled - We are planning for an emergency RDS maintenance activity in CDGC AP SouthEast 1 Services and IICS AP NorthEast 2 Services. There will be about 20 minutes of downtime during the DB Upgrade/Restart.

During this maintenance window, there will be database restarts resulting in brief interruptions for CDGC, CDMP and MCC services.

Attention: We would recommend not to schedule any critical jobs during this time window. Customer to take care of resuming any extraction jobs that failed during this maintenance window.

Any Questions ? Please contact Global Customer Support - https://www.informatica.com/services-and-training/customer-success-services/contact-us.html

item.title: Minor Maintenance on US East 4 POD for API Manager.
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - API Gateway Maintenance

API Gateway and API invocations are not impacted during this maintenance. API Manager User Interface may be unavailable during the maintenance, impacting the creation of new managed APIs and rate limit policy. All other services will continue to operate normally. Summary: Scheduled maintenance for API Gateway and API Manager User Interface may cause some disruptions, but all other services will continue to operate as normal.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 27, 03:00 - 03:30 PST

Feb 27, 01:28 PST
Scheduled - API Gateway and API invocations are not impacted during this maintenance.
API Manager User Interface may be unavailable during the maintenance impacting creation of new managed APIs and rate limit policy.

All other services will continue to operate normally.

item.title: Upcoming Maintenance patch for Cloud Data Integration
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Scheduled Maintenance Update

Summary: Scheduled maintenance patch is being applied with zero downtime update, addressing callback retries to TF from command task service.

Feb 26, 22:30 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 26, 22:21 PST
Scheduled - We are applying maintenance patch. This is a zero down time update and there should be no impact to Task executions.
Please note that this patch addresses number of callback retries to TF from command task service.

item.title: Intermittent issues with Taskflows on IICS NA East 2 Services
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Intermittent Issues Impacting Taskflow Service

A fix has been implemented for intermittent issues in the taskflow service for IICS NA East 2 Services. Runtime execution of the taskflow was impacted, but a fix has been implemented and the situation is being monitored.

Feb 25, 17:23 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 25, 16:49 PST
Update - We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

Feb 25, 16:49 PST
Monitoring - We notice some intermittent issues in taskflow service for IICS NA East 2 Services at around 3 PM PT. Runtime execution of the taskflow was impacted. A fix has been implemented at 3:17 PM PT and we are monitoring the results.

item.title: Taskflows with command tasks getting suspended in IDMC FedRAMP pod
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Taskflows with Command Tasks Going into "Suspended" State

Summary: The company has identified an issue in the execution of Taskflows with command tasks, causing them to go into a "Suspended" state. This has led to a major platform downtime and is currently being investigated.

Feb 23, 14:47 PST
Investigating - We have identified an issue in the execution of Taskflows with command tasks and such taskflows may be going to a "Suspended" state. Taskflows without command tasks are operating normally.

All other services are operating normally.
¬†
We are investigating the issue and will keep the status page updated.

Next update by 4 PM PT.

item.title: Upcoming Maintenance on February Upgraded PODs for a profile failure due to 0 size mapping metadata XML.
item.content:encoded:
[Low] - Informatica Cloud Operations Patch Application Summary: Informatica Cloud Operations will be applying a patch on all February Upgraded PODs for Cloud Data Integration and Cloud Data Quality services to resolve a profile failure due to 0 size mapping metadata XML. This is a Zero Downtime deployment and will not impact running jobs or services. Action Required: None.

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Feb 26, 01:30 - 03:30 PST

Feb 23, 08:21 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be applying a patch on all February Upgraded PODs for Cloud Data Integration and Cloud Data Quality services to resolve a profile failure due to 0 size mapping metadata XML. This is a Zero Downtime deployment and will not impact running jobs or services.

Action Required: None.

item.title: Cloud Data Quality service experiencing Gateway Timeout error for IICS Canada Central 1 Services
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Outage of Cloud Data Quality Services

Users may have experienced HTTP 503 service unavailable or HTTP 502 gateway timeout errors while accessing Cloud Data Quality services between the specified times. This indicates a major impact on the platform's availability and functionality, likely caused by a configuration change or deployment to the production system.

Feb 22, 13:30 PST
Resolved - Between the following times, users may have experienced HTTP 503 service unavailable or HTTP 502 gateway timeout errors while accessing Cloud Data Quality services.

item.title: Intermittent Performance degradation on EM West 1 POD for Cloud Application Integration
item.content:encoded:
[Medium] - Performance Degradation on Cloud Application Integration POD EM West 1

We are noticing performance degradation on EM West 1 POD for Cloud Application Integration. This might result in slower process executions and performance within the process designer. We are investigating the issue on priority.

Feb 23, 07:06 PST
Investigating - We are noticing performance degradation on EM West 1 POD for Cloud Application Integration. This might result in slower process executions and performance within the process designer. We are investigating the issue on priority.

item.title: Intermittent Performance degradation on EM West 1 POD for Cloud Application Integration
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Performance Degradation on EM West 1 POD for Cloud Application Integration Summary: We are observing performance degradation on EM West 1 POD for Cloud Application Integration, resulting in slower process executions and performance within the process designer. Our team is currently investigating this issue as a top priority.

Feb 23, 04:49 PST
Resolved - This incident has been resolved.

Feb 23, 04:47 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Feb 23, 04:04 PST
Investigating - We are observing performance degradation on EM West 1 POD for Cloud Application Integration. This can result in slower process executions and performance within the process designer. Our team is currently investigating this issue as a top priority.

item.title: Intermittent issues with Taskflows on US east 4
item.content:encoded:
[High] - Major Taskflows Outage on US East 4

Users are experiencing intermittent issues with Taskflows on US East 4, impacting both runtime and design-time. A fix has been implemented, and the situation is being monitored closely.

Feb 23, 05:31 PST
Monitoring - A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

Feb 23, 03:57 PST
Investigating - We are observing intermittent issues with Taskflows on US east 4. Both runtime and design-time is impacted. We are actively working on resolving this issue.

Scheduled - We are applying maintenance patch on US East 4 POD. This is a zero down time update and there should be no impact to Task executions.

Please note that this patch addresses intermittent 502 Bad gateway error observed during Taskflow executions.

item.title: Azure DB Maintenance affecting all services on EM Central 1 Azure
item.content:encoded:
```html

[Tag(Medium)] - Azure Database Maintenance

Summary: Microsoft Azure will be performing maintenance on an Azure hosted database, resulting in brief interruptions for all services. It is recommended not to run critical jobs during this time or to schedule a blackout period.

```

THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Mar 2, 17:00 - 18:30 PST

Feb 20, 21:27 PST
Scheduled - Microsoft Azure will be performing maintenance on an Azure hosted database which is utilized by IDMC Cloud Services. During this 90 minute maintenance window, there will be database restarts resulting in brief interruptions for all services.

Attention: We recommend not running critical jobs during this time or scheduling a blackout period during this maintenance event. https://docs.informatica.com/cloud-common-services/administrator/current-version/organization-administration/schedules/configuring-a-blackout-period.html

Any Questions ? Please contact Global Customer Support - https://www.informatica.com/services-and-training/customer-success-services/contact-us.html

Feb 15, 01:55 PST
Scheduled - Snowflake plans to rollout 2024_01 bundle related to sequences and columns, which might impact your existing Snowflake Data Cloud mapping tasks that are based on a mapping in SQL ELT mode configured with the Sequence Generator transformation. For more details about the Snowflake update, see https://docs.snowflake.com/en/release-notes/bcr-bundles/2024_01/bcr-1483?css
Snowflake Data Cloud Connector patch will make sure your mappings are not impacted because of the Snowflake update and continue to work like before. This is a Zero Downtime deployment and it will not impact any running jobs or services.

Action needed: None

Attention: This will deploy a new version of the Data Integration Service.

item.title: Change in Package Dependency Manager IP Addresses and Domain for IDMC- AP SouthEast 1, EM West 1, Canada Central 1, AP NorthEast 2, UK, EM SouthEast 1 Azure, AP NorthEast 1 Azure, US West 1 Azure, US West 3 Azure, and EM Central 1 Azure Services
item.content:encoded:
Feb 15, 22:01 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 15, 21:01 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 8, 12:07 PST
Scheduled - Informatica Intelligent Data Management is implementing a crucial enhancement to our infrastructure by introducing a unified Global Package Dependency Manager. This Global Package Dependency Manager will facilitate the seamless download of the latest Secure Agent packages across all IDMC PODs.

This update will retire the old regional package dependency manager and redirect all traffic to the new unified Global Package Dependency Manager. These changes will not impact the IP addresses for the Identity Service or other IDMC services.

To avoid any service disruption, allow the following IP addresses or domain (depending on your network policy) through your organization‚Äôs firewall before February 15, 2023.

New IP Addresses:

Primary IP addresses:
34.215.138.77
34.217.216.210
44.228.239.240

Disaster Recovery (DR) IP addresses:
34.225.222.175
44.215.191.102
174.129.76.131

New FQDN for Global Package Dependency Manager: [https://global-package.dm.informaticacloud.com|https://global-package.dm.informaticacloud.com/]

To ensure access to the new Global Package Dependency Manager, please test access from the secure agent via the following URL: [https://global-package.dm.informaticacloud.com/package-manager/mgmtapi/version]

A test utility is available for testing purposes and can be run directly from the secure agent machine. For detailed information, please refer to the FAQ: [https://knowledge.informatica.com/s/article/Change-in-Package-Dependency-Manager-IP-Addresses-and-Domain-for-IDMC-all-pods?language=en_US]

Scheduled - Informatica Cloud Operations will be applying a patch on all February Upgraded PODs for Cloud Integration Hub to address event errors while utilizing the Notification URL. This is a Zero Downtime deployment and will not impact running jobs or services.

Action needed: None.

item.title: Cloud Application Integration Public Certificate renewal on EM SouthEast 1 Azure Services
item.content:encoded:
Feb 14, 23:00 PST
Completed - The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

Feb 14, 19:01 PST
In progress - Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

Feb 8, 09:06 PST
Scheduled - The public SSL certificates for the Cloud Application Integration is scheduled for renewal on February 14, 2024, between 7:00 PM and 11:00 PM PST specifically for services on EM SouthEast 1 Azure Services. If your client application enforces comprehensive certificate chain validation, these renewed certificates can be integrated into its trust store. The article links below provide SSL certificates that will be used for renewal. These can be imported to your client's trust store, alongside any existing certificates you might already possess, if needed.

Please find the article links with Certificates:
https://knowledge.informatica.com/s/article/Cloud-Application-Integration-Server-certificate-for-Azure-EMSE-1-POD
